column4: Hi everyone, I'm running Ubuntu 10.04 (because of WiFi problems with 10.10) and my "Hardware Drivers" tool reports that "no proprietary drivers are in use by this system" and the list is empty. How do I add drivers to it? Everywhere I've read about how to use proprietary drivers said that I should use that tool, find the driver I want and just press activate. Thanks!
then run:  sudo lshw -C network   and websearch for the product line to find guides
will try that in a sec
actually i need nvidia drivers, I know how to install them but they still aren't listed in hardware drivers. and shouldnt it be as easy as pressing activate in hardware drivers?
i expected at least something to be displayed under "hardware drivers" but the list is empty...it baffles me :\
if you have a super whizzy nvidia chip then the 260 chip helps
how do i install it if its not listed in hardware drivers? with synaptic?
sure, but what video chip are you using?
ok what is the output of: lspci | grep -i vga
wow I sure am an idiot. Its an intel card :P
indeed that explains it. I somehow recalled installing nvidia drives when i installed windows...eh must have been on another PC. thanks for the assistance!
try a different output method. x11 works well in most cases
is it the same in all players?
if you make a new user and login as that is it the same? Have you tried logging in to unity2d session
